CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Zenith Imprints relative to Azure Ink Works?
SRP.A: Zenith Imprints is {above} Azure Ink Works in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Azure Ink Works relative to Zenith Imprints?
SRP.A: Azure Ink Works is {below} Zenith Imprints in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total book sales?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Azure Ink Works}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total book sales?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Zenith Imprints}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Zenith Imprints's minimum Book Sales in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Zenith Imprints's minimum Book Sales is in {1953}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Zenith Imprints's maximum Book Sales in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Zenith Imprints's maximum Book Sales is in {1977}.

NC.Q: Between 1954 and 1962, did the total Book Sales experience a larger or smaller change than between 1969 and 1970?
NC.A: The change in total book sales between 1954 and 1962 was {larger} than between 1969 and 1970.

NC.Q: Was the total Book Sales in 1959 higher or lower than in 1965?
NC.A: The total book sales in 1959 was {lower} than in 1965.

NC.Q: Was the total Book Sales in 1972 higher or lower than in 1974?
NC.A: The total book sales in 1972 was {higher} than in 1974.

NC.Q: Was the total Book Sales in 1957 higher or lower than in 1958?
NC.A: The total book sales in 1957 was {higher} than in 1958.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Azure Ink Works} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Zenith Imprints and Azure Ink Works first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Zenith Imprints and Azure Ink Works first exchanged leading positions in {1954}.
